elements.name: When a GET request is sent to the /api/courses endpoint with invalid (student or teacher) authorization credentials,
elements.description:
it should be verified that the status code is 203 and that the remark field in the response body is "failed". Additionally,
  the message field in the response body should be "To access this data, you must log in as a admin."

steps.name: The api user constructs the base url with the "student" token.
The api user sets "api/courses" path parameters.
The api user sends a "GET" request and saves the returned response.
The api user verifies that the status code is 203.
The api user confirms that the "remark" information in the response body is "failed".
The api user verifies that the "remark" information in the response body is "failed".
The api user verifies that the message information in the response body is "To access this data, you must log in as a admin."

arguments.val: "To access this data, you must log in as a admin."

steps.name: The api user verifies that the message information in the response body is "To access this data, you must log in as a admin."

arguments.val: "To access this data, you must log in as a admin."

name: As an administrator, I want to access courses via an API connection.
